results.title: Notting Hill
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Duncan Kenworthy and Roger Mitchell
results.brief_description: Hugh Grant plays William Thacker, owner of a travel bookstore in London’s Notting Hill. A chance visit to his store by famous American movie star, Anna Scott, played by Julia Roberts, sparks a complicated romance between the two. The worlds of celebrity and everyday people in collision creates a series of misunderstandings and dilemmas which divide and reunite the pair on more than one occasion. In an adventurous finale William rallies his ensemble of old friends and a mad flatmate to try one last time to get the girl. A British romantic comedy from the makers of “Four Weddings and a Funeral”. Cast also includes Hugh Bonneville, Emma Chambers and James Dreyfus.

results.title: Notorious
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A compelling drama about human relationships, fidelity, betrayal and guilt. Cary Grant plays Devlin, a secret service agent. Ingrid Bergman plays Alicia, the daughter of a convicted traitor whom Devlin enlists in a scheme to investigate the activities of surviving, post-war Nazis in Brazil.

results.title: Nothing to lose
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Martin Bregman, Don Jinks, Michael S. Bregman and Steve Oedekerk
results.brief_description: This comedy and buddy movie stars Tim Robbins and Martin Lawrence as an unlikely duo who find themsleves in the Arizona desert questioning their life choices.

results.title: Nothing sacred
results.creator_credit: Selznick International Pictures, David O. Selznick and William Wellman
results.brief_description: Carol Lombard is hilariously funny playing the role of Hazel Flagg in this outstanding black comedy. Hazel’s bumbling doctor mistakenly diagnoses her as having fatal radium poisoning. Although she’s never felt better, Hazel pretends to be dying in order to accept the offer of an all-expenses-paid visit to New York City made by a newspaper reporter. By the time the reporter begins churning out daily reports of the tragedy, half of Manhattan is in tears and Hazel is built up to be a brave ‘suffering in silence’ charmer and is lionized by the media and public. When Hazel cannot disguise her good health any longer, a group of her financial backers wise up to her ruse and ask her to find a way to die and save them all further embarassment.This was one of the first screwball comedies ever produced, and possibly one of the finest.

results.title: Not one less = Yi ge dou bu neng shao
results.creator_credit: Beijing New Picture Film Company, Guangxi Film Studio, Zhao Yu and Zhang Yimou
results.brief_description: Directed by Yimou Zhang, the rural drama “Not one less” is a study in poverty and the determination of one teenage girl. Wei Minzhi is a barely educated thirteen-year-old, who takes on a job teaching young children at an impoverished village school. As the regular teacher leaves he promises Wei bonus pay if, upon his return, all the students are still in school. Inexperienced and overwhelmed, but relentlessly stubborn, Wei faces ingratitude and her own misery as she grapples with the recalcitrant students. When one boy is sent to work in the city, where he lives on the street, Wei pursues him. Once there Wei is overwhelmed by the crowds, bustling street life and enormity of the task of finding a young boy amid the vast city and innumerable homeless children who reside there. Here Zhang steers away from the lush melodramas, such as “Raise the red lantern”, “Red sorghum” and “Shanghai Triad”, in favour of a sparse aesthetic that speaks of the plight of rural Chinese, portraying village life decimated by the commercialisation of China.

results.title: Nostalgia = Nostalghia
results.creator_credit: Opera Film Produzione, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Sovin Film, Francesco Casati and Andrei Tarkovsky
results.brief_description: This is Tarkovsky’s haunting first film made outside of Russia. The story explores the melancholy of the expatriate through the eyes of the film’s protagonist, Gorchakov, a Russian poet researching in Italy. Arriving at a Tuscan village spa with Eugenia, his beautiful Italian interpreter, Gorchakov is visited by memories of Russia and of his wife and children, and encounters the local mystic, who sets him a challenging task. The film is filled with mysterious and extraordinary images, culminating in the final scene where all the film’s images coalesce into a miraculous whole. As in all Tarkovsky films, nature and the elements of fire and water, music, painting and poetry, and the contrast of black and white and colour photography, all play a major role. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Nosferatu [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Prana-Film, Enrico Dieckman, Albin Grau and Frederick Murnau
results.brief_description: Hutter is a German real estate agent newly married and extremely excited about his latest transaction, selling a property to the reclusive Herr Orlok, who lives in remote Transylvania. Despite the warnings of the local peasants and the imploring of his wife, Hutter travels to Orlok’s castle where he begins to suspect that his client may not be of this world. Orlok travels by boat to Bremen where he prepares to realise the evil intentions he nurses for Hutter’s beautiful young wife. Although the plot is quite close to that of Bram Stoker’s Dracula, the emotional and intellectual emphases are different. The figure of Count Orlok resembling an animated corpse is far from Stoker’s well-groomed, demonic vampire and Nosferatu exhibits none of the shadow play of Caligari. Director Murnau showed how the fantastic film could gain from the use of real settings and the imaginative treatment of space. This feeling of landscape became a central element of the classic vampire film.

results.title: Northwest passage
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Loew's Inc, Hunt Stromberg and King Vidor
results.brief_description: An American historical drama about a group of settlers known as Rogers’ Rangers - led by Major Rogers (Spencer Tracy) - and the hardships of survival and battles with hostile Indians, they encounter in trying to settle the upper New York state area for their families in the late 1750s and early 1760s. Based on the novel “Roger’s rangers” by Kenneth Roberts. Cast includes Robert Young, Walter Brennan. Ruth Hussey.

results.title: North by northwest
results.brief_description: Alfred Hitchcock nominated this literal cliff hanger as the film that most epitomised the elements of his years of making thrillers. Roger Thornhill (Cary Grant) is a smug but successful Madison Avenue advertising executive who is plunged into the world of espionage when he his mistaken for mythical agent George Kaplan who US intelligence has created to flush out spies. Matters are further complicated when he meets Eve Kendall (Eva Saint-Marie) who further jeopardises his life while being romantically involved with him. Kidnapped by spies, Thornhill escapes but is then accused of killing a UN diplomat. He is pursued by both spies and the police and desperately flees across country, buzzed by a crop duster plane in one of the films most memorable scenes. His meeting with arch spy James Mason on the Mount Rushmore monument provides the heart-stopping climax as the pair fight it out on the giant sculptures of former US presidents.

constellations_other.name: Elevator Operator: Up and down, the on-screen gift of elevators
constellations_other.description: Inspired by Courtney Barnett playing an elevator operator in her hit song of the same name, we look at how they're used on-screen for comedy, drama and suspense, with the small, confined boxes forcing characters to physically confront each other.
